data.title: Pankali, Paṅkāli, Paṅkāḷi: 1 definition
data.meta_description: Paṅkāli (பங்காலி) noun Bat; வெளவால். (யாழ்ப்பாணத்து மானிப்பாயகராதி) [velaval. (yazhppanathu manippayagarathi)]--- OR --- Paṅkāḷi (பங்காளி) noun < ப...
data.text:
Introduction:

Pankali means something in Tamil. If you want to know the exact meaning, history, etymology or English translation of this term then check out the descriptions on this page. Add your comment or reference to a book if you want to contribute to this summary article.

Languages of India and abroad

Tamil dictionary

Source: DDSA: University of Madras: Tamil Lexicon

Paṅkāli (பங்காலி) noun Bat; வெளவால். (யாழ்ப்பாணத்து மானிப்பாயகராதி) [velaval. (yazhppanathu manippayagarathi)]

--- OR ---

Paṅkāḷi (பங்காளி) noun < பங்கு¹ [pangu¹] +. (W.)

1. Shareholder, partner, co-parcener; உடன்கூட்டா யிருப்பவன். [udankutta yiruppavan.]

2. Agnate, kinsman; தாயாதி. [thayathi.]

--- OR ---

Paṅkāḷi (பங்காளி) noun < Vaṅga. Bengali, native of Bengal; பங்காளதேசத்தவன். [pangalathesathavan.]

--- OR ---

Paṅkāḷi (பங்காளி) noun < பங்கு [pangu] +. An officer whose duty was to prepare a record of all the holdings in a village; ஊரார் நிலஉரிமைகளை வகுத் தெழுதும் உத்தியோகஸ்தன். [urar nilaurimaigalai vaguth thezhuthum uthiyogasthan.] (கடம்பர். திருவிசைப்பா [kadambar. thiruvisaippa], 50.)

context information

Tamil is an ancient language of India from the Dravidian family spoken by roughly 250 million people mainly in southern India and Sri Lanka.

Discover the meaning of pankali in the context of Tamil from relevant books on Exotic India

See also (Relevant definitions)

Starts with: Pankalicci.

Ends with: Kampankali, Teruppankali, Uppankali.

Full-text: Pankalan, Pangali, Para-pattiyakuttali, Pakastan, Kashtakkuttali, Teruppankali, Oppuravukkaran, Kuttali.
